docs.snippet: Google-owned YouTube has been the internet’s go-to destination for both viewers and would-be stars. Now it’s getting some competition from the leading social network.

headline.print_headline: Daily Report: Facebook Takes Aim at YouTube’s Video Dominance
headline.main: Daily Report: Facebook Takes Aim at YouTube’s Video Dominance

docs.snippet: The best-known video celebrities gravitate to the mass audience of YouTube. But some others are carving a niche on the worlds biggest social network.

headline.print_headline: Why Some Online Video Stars  Opt for Facebook Over YouTube
headline.main: Why Some Online Video Stars Opt for Facebook Over YouTube

docs.snippet: In an invitation-only group, wives grapple with issues from finding a home in a new city to living with a player’s debilitating concussive injuries.

headline.main: Inside the Facebook Group Where N.F.L. Wives Share Anxieties and Advice

docs.snippet: Under pressure from governments to counter inappropriate content, the social media company will pair new technology with human moderators.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Will Use Artificial Intelligence to Uncover Extremist Posts
headline.main: Facebook Will Use Artificial Intelligence to Find Extremist Posts

docs.snippet: To understand Facebook’s new emphasis on private groups, I joined more than 100, ranging from gardeners to flat-earth truthers.

headline.print_headline: Bees? Pot? Going Behind  Velvet Ropes  At Facebook
headline.main: Behind the Velvet Ropes of Facebook’s Private Groups

docs.snippet: You can create a question post for your Facebook timeline that encourages your friends to give their advice, complete with links and maps.
Social media platforms aren’t bound by the First Amendment. That’s why understanding their user speech policies is so important.

headline.print_headline: Speech in the Social Public Square
headline.main: Facebook, Free Expression and the Power of a Leak

docs.snippet: Data protection watchdogs in France and the Netherlands ruled that the social network had collected too much information on users in those countries.

headline.print_headline: Facebook Challenged On Privacy In Europe
headline.main: Facebook Gets Slap on the Wrist From 2 European Privacy Regulators

docs.snippet: Instagram, now with 700 million users, resembles Facebook in 2009 to 2012, when it went from being something people used occasionally to something they use every day.

headline.main: Why Instagram Is Becoming Facebook’s Next Facebook

docs.snippet: The European Union’s antitrust chief fined the social media company about $122 million for providing misleading statements in its WhatsApp acquisition.

headline.print_headline: Daily Report: Europe Gets Tough on Facebook
headline.main: Daily Report: Europe Gets Tough on Facebook
